intro: Diplopeltis huegelii, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its leaves are often covered with fine hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact.
